hints.label: thm-adaptive-qsd
hints.title: Adaptive Forces at QSD
hints.content:
197: :label: thm-adaptive-qsd
198: 
199: At the quasi-stationary distribution $\mu_{\text{QSD}}$, the adaptive force contributions satisfy:
200: 
201: 1. **No bulk flow**: The mean velocity vanishes to leading order:
202:    $$
203:    u^i_{\text{QSD}} = \frac{\varepsilon_F}{\gamma} \nabla^i V_{\text{fit}}[\rho_{\text{QSD}}] = O(\varepsilon_F)
204:    $$
205: 
206: 2. **Stationary solution**: The QSD density $\rho_{\text{QSD}}(x)$ is the unique solution to the zero-flux condition:
207:    $$
208:    \rho \nabla (U + \varepsilon_F V_{\text{fit}}[\rho]) = \frac{k_B T}{m} \nabla \rho
209:    $$
210:    which implicitly defines $\rho_{\text{QSD}}$ as a functional of the self-consistent potential.
211: 
212: 3. **Vanishing source**: $J^\nu_{\text{adapt}}[\mu_{\text{QSD}}] = 0$ since $\partial \rho_{\text{QSD}}/\partial t = 0$.
213: 
214: 4. **Anisotropic stress**: The diffusion tensor creates anisotropic stress:
215:    $$
216:    T_{ij} = m\rho \frac{k_B T_{\text{eff}}}{m} \left[\delta^{ij} + \varepsilon_F \Delta G^{ij}(x) + O(\varepsilon_F^2)\right]
217:    $$
218:    where $\Delta G^{ij} = G_{\text{reg}}^{ij} - (\text{tr } G_{\text{reg}}/d) \delta^{ij}$ is the traceless part.
219: 
220: **Consequence**: At leading order in $\varepsilon_F$, the stress-energy tensor is:
221: 
222: $$
223: T_{\mu\nu}[\mu_{\text{QSD}}] = m\rho \frac{k_B T_{\text{eff}}}{m} g_{\mu\nu} + O(\varepsilon_F)
224: $$
225: 
226: The Einstein equations remain:
227: 
228: $$
229: G_{\mu\nu} = 8\pi G T_{\mu\nu}
230: $$
231:
